body.name: The Rule of Threes: A Novella
body.description: Constant Marlowe follows a serial killer deep into the dark heart of a small town in this riveting novella by Jeffery Deaver, the New York Times bestselling author of The Broken Doll collection and the Colter Shaw series.Special Agent Constant Marlowe is tasked with taking over the investigation of an obsessed serial killer trolling the small town of Clark Valley in the quiet—and eerie—plains of the Midwest. Two female victims in quick succession, the same brutal MO, and every indication that victim number three is only days away. Also in the killer’s scope is Constant herself. When she interviews a local family who may be potential witnesses, she leads the devil to their doorstep, throwing their lives into chaos. Constant will do anything to protect them, but it won’t be easy. Because nothing in Clark Valley is quite what it seems.

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #70 in Kindle Store (See Top 100 in Kindle Store) #1 in Serial Killer Thrillers #1 in Kindle Singles: Mystery, Thriller & Suspense #1 in Murder

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A fantastic read! Deaver never disappoints!
reviews.reviewText: Unlike many very prolific & successful authors, the quality of Deaver’s writing never declines! Whether it’s a short story, novella or full-length novel, you are still treated to a fast paced, intricate plot with multiple fascinating characters that still keep you on the edge of your seat! Ordinarily, I’m not a huge fan of short stories or novellas, but I make an exception for Deaver’s works because I don’t have to sacrifice quality. The main character in this novella made a previous appearance in either a short story or another novella. Because she’s such a complex character, I was happy to see her fill the central role in this novella.If you’re new to Deaver and are looking for a good entry point, I highly recommend reading this novella! You’ll get a feel for his writing style, plot pacing & character development so you can decide if you’re interesting in reading more of Deaver’s work.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A good rainy day read
reviews.reviewText: It's nice to have a few familiar authors this month, and seeing a Jeffrey Deaver story made the First Reads choice easy. Deaver has a talent for surprise twists in a short story format and I always enjoy his stories."The Rule of Threes" is described as a Novella, and while not as long as a full-length book, it's still substantial enough to make it a worth-while First Reads selection. Just keep in mind that Amazon often adds Deaver short stories to their "Prime Reading" selection to borrow for free so if another book catches your eye this month there is a good chance you will have an opportunity to read this one as well for free at a later time.The first surprise twist comes later on in this story, but once it does, the twists and turns come as often as one has come to expect with this author. Perhaps a little more predictable than usual but they are there, along with a cast of nasty characters. We also see a return of tough, take-law-in-her-own-hands Agent Constant Marlowe from the Broken Doll series of short stories.Some language but not excessive enough to be distracting. Rape, murder, hate crimes etc are main themes but while present, are not described in gory detail.A quick, enjoyable read for this rainy day spent at home.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewText: First off the author intentionally misleads the reader about the killer. This is done so he can have a oh my gosh moment later. Second the whole reality of the killers is so over the top as to be ridiculous.Expect the main character to be tough and proficient. That’s normal for this kind of story. But a sheriff who operates a high tech forensic lab is too much.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: What I really enjoyed was how the writing was such a reflection of the main character. Her no-nonsense approach to the case (and life) was reinforced by the cadence of the story.And what a story it was. If you like true crime TV, you’ll really appreciate how this one unfolds.Great plot. Fascinating characters – both good and bad, and an unfamiliar setting brought to life by the skills of the writer. The Novella length was just right. It allowed for a complete story to unfold with a great rhythm and no excess.What a pleasant surprise from the Amazon Kindle first Program. One of the best I’ve come across.VFL.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Rape trigger’sJeffery Deaver is a must buy, must read author. This novella ends with them looking for another member of the criminal family. Easy to follow and difficult to put down. No editing errors, gratuitous violence or drag-you-down drama.Fast-paced storyline with descriptive writing that draws the reader into each scene. Plenty of twists to keep one guessing. Realistic procedures, actions and reactions. Believable characters with distinct personalities and memorable dialogue.John said thoughtfully, “You know, you get your driver’s license, forget the vision test. They should do a psych exam.”Kit and Marlowe said simultaneously, “Or IQ.”No desire to re-read this story. I always look forward to works by this author.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Tired of Predictable?
reviews.reviewText: I read a LOT of books. The bulk of them are suspense, mystery, and whodunnit types. I enjoy them immensely, but do often find them to be predictable.Jeffery Deaver, you impressed me. I did NOT see that ending coming at all. Even after the reveal you kept me engaged in what happens next. I’m on the hook for the next book and please tell me there’s another one coming!Read this, you won’t regret it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Confusing for me
reviews.reviewText: I did not like the story’s organization. Way too much of the O’Henry twist style with illogical expose after unexpected development. Then the civil rights lectures. So, the novella was not for me and I lost interest as the pages flew along.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars This novella had me turning circles
reviews.reviewText: The protagonist in this story, Constant Marlowe, is likable and one b.a. cop. If I don’t like the protagonist(s) I lose interest, but that didn’t happen here. So with a hero I could root for, an interesting cast of good guys and bad, and all The macabre twists and turns Jeffery Deaver is known for “The Rule of Threes: A Novella,” was highly enjoyable and entertaining.I submit that thriller and drama fans give it a read, it won’t take long. Check it out.I give it four stars for great pop culture references as well as holding my interest as an enjoyable read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Rule of 3 was a great read really enjoyed it plenty of twists that kept you wanting more looking forward Tina fallow up
Well that was a twist in a half wasn’t expecting that, but then Jeffery Deaver knows how to keep you interested. Hopefully there is a new book coming to complete the story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: An excellent police procedural with a good twisty plot.
reviews.reviewText: I am not sure that this is a 'novella' at 261 pages but it is certainly shorter than most of Deaver's novels. An excellent story with good characters and a very twisty plot. I gasped out loud at one point! I very much liked Constant Marlowe and it seems that she has appeared in other books. It looks like my TBR will be growing again. Definitely recommend this for lovers of police procedurals with a good twisty plot.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Great read with some great twists well worth the read! Couldn’t put it down 👍 what a great story line

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Having read lots of Deaver books in the past, thought I would give this a try, and it was a freeby. Clever storyline and brilliant twist at the end.
